avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. The snowpack is considered stable. Slight new snow forcasted the next days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. The snowpack is considered stable after the thaw and rain the last days. Slight new snow forcasted the next days.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow expected to be unstable in N- and E-part of the country on Saturday after NE-E wind and snowfall.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow expected to be unstable in N- and E-part of the country on Saturday after NE-E wind and snowfall.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlæg átt og lítilsháttar úrkoma, rigning, slydda/snjókoma, næstu daga. Bætir í vind seinnipart laugardags.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow expected next days in NE-snjowstorm. Older snow is uniform and stable after thaw followed by freezing.

snowpackStructure.highlights: During mild weather and rain January 10th-15th, the snow melted, settled, and layers broke down. Now temperatures have dropped below freezing, and snow should be stiff and stable. NE-snwstorm or snowshowers are forecast for the next few days.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow expected to be unstable in N- and E-part of the country on Saturday after NE-E wind and snowfall.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow expected to be unstable in N- and E-part of the country on Saturday after NE-E wind and snowfall.

weatherForecast.highlights: Spáð er frosti og éljagangi eða hríð í norðausta átt næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.comment: A snowmobile triggered an avalanche in Upsadalur west of Dalvik on Thursday January 9th. A natural avalanche fell in Dýjadalur, either on January 9th or 10th and a small slab in Karlsárdalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snowfall on Saturday could form new unstable wind slabs. The old snow has subsided and strengthened due to thaw.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It has snowed a bit in the last few days. Some snowfall is expected during strong wind, especially on Saturday, with drifting in an easterly wind. Thin, unstable wind slabs could form. The old snow was most likely stable in most places.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow expected to be unstable in N- and E-part of the country on Saturday after NE-E wind and snowfall.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow expected to be unstable in N- and E-part of the country on Saturday after NE-E wind and snowfall.

weatherForecast.highlights: A-NA 13-20 m/s og snjókoma með köflum næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small wet avalanche released in Fannardalur the 12th of January.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Unstable wind slabs expected on Saturday after strong NE-E wind and snowfall. The old snow is considered stable after the thaw.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Heavy snowfall is forecasted during strong NE-E winds the night before and on Saturday. Wind slabs are expected to form, especially on S-W aspects and gullies, and that they will be unstable at first. The old snow is considered stable. Chances of ongoing snowfall on Sunday until Monday with increasing wind slab formation.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow expected to be unstable in N- and E-part of the country on Saturday after NE-E wind and snowfall.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow expected to be unstable in N- and E-part of the country on Saturday after NE-E wind and snowfall.

weatherForecast.highlights: Mikil snjókoma aðfaranótt laugardags í hvassri N- til A-átt. Syttir líklega víða upp eftir hádegi á laugardag en spár gera ráð fyrir áframhaldandi snjókoma á sunnudag hvassri í N-A átt. Hiti við frostmark við sjávarsíðuna.
